snippet: The post-recession reality is that the customer base for businesses that appeal to the middle class is shrinking as the top tier pulls even further away.
abstract: Evidence that economic inequality is deepening across America can be shown by fact that customer base for businesses that appeal to middle class is shrinking as top-tier pulls even further away; effects of this phenomenon, which has caused many mid-tier retailers or restaurant chains to lose profits and, in some cases, declare bankruptcy, are now rippling through one sector after another in the American economy.
lead_paragraph: The post-recession reality is that the customer base for businesses that appeal to the middle class is shrinking as the top tier pulls even further away.

headline.main: The Middle Class Is Steadily Eroding. Just Ask the Business World.
headline.print_headline: The Middle Class Is Steadily Eroding. Just Ask the Business World.
